title: Photography and Architecture: 1839-1939
description:
With more than 125 photographs from the collections of the Canadian Centre for Architecture, Photography and Architecture: 1839-1939 explored the study of architectural photographs as a means to provide additional insights into the works they captured. As the curator of this exhibition, Richard Pare, noted this exhibition “. . . encompass[ed] the history of photography through architecture and the history of architecture through photography.”
The content of sample photographs in this exhibition included: nineteenth century studies of India, Burma, Jerusalem, and the western United States, as well as work from Britain and France.
